section.section: Each board consists of 7 members appointed by the Governor.
The board for each State residential center shall reflect adequately the composition of the community that the State residential center serves.

Of the 7 members of the board for a State residential center:
At least 2 shall be parents or other relatives or guardians of residents of that State residential center; and
Each of the others shall be individuals who:
Are known for their interest in civic and public affairs; and
Have expressed an active interest in the care of individuals with an intellectual disability, or generally in intellectual disability endeavors.

The Governor shall appoint the members from a list of qualified individuals submitted to the Governor by the Secretary. The number of names on the list shall be at least twice the number of vacancies.

text.section: Each member of the board for a State residential center shall be a resident of the region that the State residential center serves.

section.section: The term of a member is 4 years.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who serves 2 consecutive full 4-year terms may not be reappointed for 4 years after the completion of those terms.
